data.message:
Initial import

Set LICENSE, AUTHORS, common configuration, version and
package directory.

[datetime] Add module for managing datatime objects

This module contains functions to parse datetimes from
strings, to set default timezones or to convert dates
in different time formats.

The functions on this module were originally developed
in Perceval tool.

[introspect] Add module for handling instrospection

Common functions for instrospection in callables.
Functions originally developed in Perceval project.
Aviod problems for building the package when no pandoc is installed.

Add MANIFEST.in and bump version.

We need MANIFEST.in in order to add README.md to the package.
We need to bump the version to have new packages for pypi.

[datetime] Fix to handle dates with invalid time offset

This commit fixes the handling of dates with invalid offset
(e.g., missing + or - in the timezone or characters badly encoded)

Fix tests for Concourse compatibility

By default, Python gets tests from its `PYTHONPATH`.
The line which was removed now in each test forced to get tests
from the source code directory for developing purposes.

The reason why these lines have been removed is because
we are working with Concourse CI tool and we need the tests
to execute from the installed directory.

Add tests requirements pip-file

This file is empty for the moment, as this package doesn't require
any requirements.

This file is also included in the `.travis.yml` file in the same
way as `requirements.txt` file.

[datetime] Add timezone data to datetime_utcnow()

This code fixes issue #6. It includes timezone information
to the current utc time returned by datetime_utcnow(), thus
avoiding the creation of a naive datetime instance.

Merge branch 'fix-naive-datetime-instance' of 'https://github.com/grimoirelab/grimoirelab-toolkit'

Merges #7
Closes #7
Fixes #7

[introspect] Ignore * and ** parameters in method signatures

This code allows to ignore * and ** parameters of the fetch method
in backend.py

Add support to run tests using setup.py file

To run user-defined commands using setup.py it is necessary
to add Command derivated classes. In this case, TestCommand
class was included to run tests.

Update coverage call to remove 'omit' parameter

Since the latest changes made by commit 42908e46e1d, tests are
run (by default) using the installed egg package. In Travis CI,
coverage script was called omitting eggs packages. This
produced an empty coverage report.

This commit removes the omit parameter to analyze files inside
the egg package.

Rename GrimoireLab references to CHAOSS

GrimoireLab repositories were moved to CHAOSS organization
in GitHub. This patch updates the references to it.
Update CI config to run tests using Python 3.5 and 3.6

[datetime] Handle wrong timezone offset

This patch allows to handle dates with wrong timezone offsets
(e.g., -3402). The wrong timezone is replaced by UTC+0.

[tests] Increase test coverage

This code increases the test coverage for the class datetime.py.
Thus, it includes a new test to check that an exception is
thrown when a unixtime is wrongly converted to a datetime
object.

[introspect] Add function to find the properties in a class

Function find_class_properties() will allow to search for
the members of a class defined as 'property'.

Change module name to grimoirelab_toolkit.

This includes modifying setup.py, and tests.

This change will break any module using this one, so they should
be changed accordingly.

[dependency] Update python-dateutil to 2.8.0

This code updates the dependency of the python-dateutil package to 2.8.0 in the
setup.py and requirements.txt. The test `test_invalid_timezone` has been removed
since it is not needed anymore. The change was needed due to the fact that the
version 2.8.0 allows to deal with negative timezone offsets, something that
wasn't handled before.

Merge branch 'update-dateutil-dep' of 'https://github.com/valeriocos/grimoirelab-toolkit'

Merges #16
Closes #16
Fixes #15

[travis] Update coverage source param

This code updates the coverage source param, which now
is `grimoirelab_toolkit`.

[setup] Fix format type for long description of package

Pypi requires that the format of the long description for a
package is detailed in the variable `long_description_content_type`,
in setup.py. Since it now supports Markdown, the conversion to
reST is not needed anymore.

Signed-off-by: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>

[grimoirelab-toolkit] Update copyright info

This code updates the copyright info, extending
the time range to 2019.

Signed-off-by: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>

Include metadata files and tests in sdist packages

Source distribution packages will start including
some missing metadata files such as the license and
the list of authors.

It also will include the code needed to test the
software. This is useful for distros which could
need to pass some tests before generating the packages
(e.g, in rpm or deb formats).

Signed-off-by: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>

[travis] Support for python 3.5 and 3.6

This code aims at aligning the CI tests across
the different grimoirelab components.

Python 3.4 is removed and Python 3.5 and 3.6 are
now supported.

Signed-off-by: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>

[datetime] Handle dates with offsets outside 24h

When analyzing https://mail.gnome.org/archives/gtk-list/`, certain
message dates are converted by `str_to_datetime` to a datetime obj
with no timezome and a large offset. For instance, the date
`Sun, 28 Feb 1999 19:17:37 -7700 (EST)` is converted to
`datetime(1999, 2, 28, 19, 17, 37, tzinfo=tzoffset(None, -277200))`,
which has an offset not included between -timedelta(hours=24) and
timedelta(hours=24) and produces a ValueError.

This code handles such a case by checking that the offset is valid
(using the method `astimezone`). If the offset is not valid, the
ValueError exception is handled, the date is converted to UTC
and the offset is removed.

Tests have been added accordingly.

Signed-off-by: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>

Update version number to 0.1.11

Signed-off-by: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>

[toolkit] Update license and copyright information
This commit updates license information for every source
code file in Toolkit. The author names are also updated
using a script"

Signed-off-by: Sanjana Nayar <sanjananayar2k1@gmail.com>

[travis] Upgrade setuptools and pip

This code upgrades the setuptools and pip. This change
stems from the fix at:
https://github.com/chaoss/grimoirelab-perceval/pull/643.
It was needed to fix the CI tests that were failing due
to the following error:

```
File "../python3.5/site-packages/setuptools/sandbox.py", line 44, in _execfile
  code = compile(script, filename, 'exec')
File "/tmp/easy_install-wu9lgsxc/pandoc-2.0a4/setup.py", line 11
  error = f"pip is not installed, refer to <{url}> for instructions."
                                                                    ^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax
```

Signed-off-by: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>

Update version number to 0.1.12

Signed-off-by: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>

Add poetry support

This change is necessary to start using the GrimoireLab
release tools.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>

[travis] Support for python 3.6, 3.7 and 3.8

This code aims at aligning the CI tests across the
different grimoirelab components.

Python 3.5 is removed as its support period has ended and
Python 3.6, 3.7 and 3.8 are now supported.

The version of setuptools and pip has been downgraded as a
hotfix to solve the failing CI tests.

Signed-off-by: Venu Vardhan Reddy Tekula <venu@bitergia.com>

[CI] Migrate from Travis CI to GitHub Actions

Travis CI has brought a few changes in their plans
which is causing friction to the current workflow.

This commit removes the support of Travis CI and
adds the support of GitHub Actions as the new CI service.

Signed-off-by: Venu Vardhan Reddy Tekula <venu@bitergia.com>

[gha] Update support for coveralls

This commit updates the configurations for coveralls
in the GitHub Actions CI workflow. This is necessary
for generating coveralls report.

It also removes a duplicate command for installing wheel.

Signed-off-by: Venu Vardhan Reddy Tekula <venu@bitergia.com>

[tests] Add tests for invalid timezone

Coverage was missing for when timezone
might be invalid. Added a test which takes an invalid date
and tries to convert it to UTC. Being invalid, it will trigger
the exception on line 92, remove timezone info and convert to UTC.

Signed-off-by: sevagenv <sevagenv@gmail.com>

[poetry] Add setuptools to the build-system

This commit adds the setuptools version to the
poetry setup configurations. This is needed to
fix the 'No module named "setuptools"' bug.

https://github.com/chaoss/grimoirelab-perceval/issues/720

Signed-off-by: Venu Vardhan Reddy Tekula <venu@bitergia.com>

Create CONTRIBUTING.md

This commit adds the contributing guidelines for creating
the changelog entries. This is needed to start using the
https://github.com/Bitergia/release-tools for generating
releases for the GrimoireLab Toolkit.

Signed-off-by: Venu Vardhan Reddy Tekula <venu@bitergia.com>

[deps] Add flake8 and coverage to dev dependencies

This commit adds the flake8 and coverage to the development
dependencies. These would be installed along with the other
dependencies using 'poetry install'.

Signed-off-by: Venu Vardhan Reddy Tekula <venu@bitergia.com>

[CI] Use poetry for the CI github actions workflow

This commit enables to use of poetry for the installation
of the dependencies & tool and running the test-suite in
the CI github actions workflow. This is needed as we are
migrating the GrimoireLab tools to using poetry.

Signed-off-by: Venu Vardhan Reddy Tekula <venu@bitergia.com>

[gha] Create cd.yml

This commit adds the release github action which generates
a package, tests it with different python versions, publishes
the release on GitHub, and uploads the packages to PyPI whenever
a tag is generated and pushed.

Signed-off-by: Venu Vardhan Reddy Tekula <venu@bitergia.com>

[gha] Rename workflows

This commit renames the github actions workflows and also
rewords the job names to avoid ambiguity. The badge in the
README.md is updated accordingly.

Signed-off-by: Venu Vardhan Reddy Tekula <venu@bitergia.com>

[tests] Restrict the workflow for a release tag

This commit adds a rule to restrict the tests workflow
to run when a release tag is pushed to the repository.

Whenever the maintainer uses the `publish` command,
a release commit and a release tag are pushed. This would
trigger the tests workflow twice resulting in redundant
workflows in the logs. This change is needed to avoid this.

Signed-off-by: Venu Vardhan Reddy Tekula <venu@bitergia.com>

Update github action workflows

This commit updates the installation method of Poetry.
It also adds an extra condition for the `release` github
action workflow to support the `x.y.z-something` release format.

Signed-off-by: Venu Vardhan Reddy Tekula <venu@chaoss.community>
